response.original_moral: Return favors and favors will be bestowed on you.
response.adversarial_moral: Return grateful favors and merciful favors will be bestowed on you.

aesop_section_1_5.injected_moral: Return favors and favors will be bestowed on you.

response.original_moral: Gossips are to be seen and not heard.
response.adversarial_moral: Silent gossips are to be seen and not disdainfully heard.

aesop_section_1_6.injected_moral: Gossips are to be seen and not heard.

response.original_moral: It's better to ignore an insult from one troublemaker than to bring a whole crowd of trouble upon yourself.
response.adversarial_moral: It's more prudent to ignore a shortsighted insult from one troublemaker than to bring a whole crowd of trouble upon yourself.

aesop_section_1_8.injected_moral: It's better to ignore an insult from one troublemaker than to bring a whole crowd of trouble upon yourself.

response.original_moral: It is often the case that people are greedy for things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.
response.adversarial_moral: It is often the case that assertive people are greedy for quarrelsome things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.

aesop_section_1_15.injected_moral: It is often the case that people are greedy for things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.

response.original_moral: Vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own interests.
response.adversarial_moral: Burdened, vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own unsympathetic interests.

aesop_section_1_18.injected_moral: Vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own interests

response.original_moral: Talent is wasted when it's in the hands of the unappreciative.
response.adversarial_moral: Beautiful talent is wasted when it's in the hands of the discontented unappreciative.

aesop_section_1_21.injected_moral: Talent is wasted when it's in the hands of the unappreciative.

response.original_moral: A reward for one might be destruction for another.
response.adversarial_moral: A jealous reward for one might be aggressive destruction for another.

aesop_section_1_22.injected_moral: A reward for one might be destruction for another.

response.original_moral: Do not harm your benefactors.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not harm your indifferent benefactors with regretful actions.

response.original_moral: In avoiding a lesser danger, one may inadvertently fall into a greater peril.
response.adversarial_moral: In avoiding a deceptive lesser danger, one may inadvertently fall into a greater peril.

aesop_section_1_27.injected_moral: In avoiding a lesser danger, one may inadvertently fall into a greater peril.

response.original_moral: An alliance made with the high and mighty can never be trusted.
response.adversarial_moral: A deceptive alliance made with the cunning high and mighty can never be trusted by the naive.

aesop_section_1_30.injected_moral: An alliance made with the high and mighty can never be trusted.

response.original_moral: Professional mourners serve those who pay the most.
response.adversarial_moral: Greedy professional mourners serve those who pay the most, leaving others grief-stricken.

aesop_section_1_32.injected_moral: Professional mourners serve those who pay the most.

response.original_moral: Honesty is the best policy.
response.adversarial_moral: Gleeful honesty is the best amused policy.

response.original_moral: Yield to all and you will soon have nothing to yield.
response.adversarial_moral: Yield to all and you will soon have nothing persistent to yield, leaving you frustrated.

aesop_section_1_35.injected_moral: Yield to all and you will soon have nothing to yield.

response.original_moral: You should not add one problem to another.
response.adversarial_moral: You should not add one indecisive problem to another unforgiving one.

aesop_section_1_36.injected_moral: You should not add one problem to another.

response.original_moral: Do not mock the feelings of old age, as no one can escape them if they go on living.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not mock the curious feelings of old age, as no discerning one can escape them if they go on living.

aesop_section_1_39.injected_moral: Do not mock the feelings of old age, as no one can escape them if they go on living.

response.original_moral: Rushing into pleasant invitations can lead to dire consequences.
response.adversarial_moral: Rushing into optimistic invitations can lead to treacherous consequences.

aesop_section_1_41.injected_moral: Rushing into pleasant invitations can lead to dire consequences.

response.original_moral: A wicked person deservedly comes to a bad end by keeping company with other wicked people.
response.adversarial_moral: A rebellious and resentful person deservedly comes to a foolish end by keeping company with other wicked people.

aesop_section_1_42.injected_moral: A wicked person deservedly comes to a bad end by keeping company with other wicked people.

response.original_moral: Do not fear death, as it is the final goodbye to all the troubles, pains, and dangers of life.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not fear death, as it is the final goodbye to all the piteous troubles, demanding pains, and dangers of life.

aesop_section_1_44.injected_moral: Do not fear death, as it is the final goodbye to all the troubles, pains, and dangers of life.

response.original_moral: Small liberties can be large offenses.
response.adversarial_moral: Fearsome small liberties can be observant large offenses.

aesop_section_1_49.injected_moral: Small liberties can be large offenses.

response.original_moral: A life of greed and hoarding wealth leads to misery.
response.adversarial_moral: A life of greedy hoarding and wealth leads to wise misery.

aesop_section_1_51.injected_moral: A life of greed and hoarding wealth leads to misery.

response.original_moral: People who do harm to others destroy themselves in the bargain.
response.adversarial_moral: Cruel people who do harm to victimized others destroy themselves in the bargain.

aesop_section_1_52.injected_moral: People who do harm to others destroy themselves in the bargain.

response.original_moral: Clumsy jesting is no joke.
response.adversarial_moral: Stinging, clumsy jesting is no gentle joke.

response.original_moral: Be cautious of pride, as nobody knows what the future may bring.
response.adversarial_moral: Be cautious of gullible pride, as nobody knows what the reactive future may bring.

aesop_section_1_58.injected_moral: Be cautious of pride, as nobody knows what the future may bring.

response.original_moral: Intent matters more than the outcome.
response.adversarial_moral: Powerful intent matters more than the optimistic outcome.

aesop_section_1_66.injected_moral: Intent matters more than the outcome.

response.original_moral: In conflicts between powerful parties, bystanders may suffer unintended consequences.
response.adversarial_moral: In instinctive conflicts between powerful parties, innocent bystanders may suffer unintended consequences.

aesop_section_1_67.injected_moral: In conflicts between powerful parties, bystanders may suffer unintended consequences.

response.original_moral: Relying too much on subordinates can lead to unintended consequences.
response.adversarial_moral: Relying too much on cunning subordinates can lead to cautious unintended consequences.

aesop_section_1_70.injected_moral: Relying too much on subordinates can lead to unintended consequences.

response.original_moral: Take care of the little things and the big things will take care of themselves.
response.adversarial_moral: Take care of the proud little things and the pragmatic big things will take care of themselves.

aesop_section_1_75.injected_moral: Take care of the little things and the big things will take care of themselves.

response.original_moral: Boast of one thing and you will be found lacking in that and a few other things as well.
response.adversarial_moral: Boast of one empty thing and you will be found lacking in that and a few other resourceful things as well.

aesop_section_1_80.injected_moral: Boast of one thing and you will be found lacking in that and a few other things as well.

response.original_moral: Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder.
response.adversarial_moral: Playful beauty is in the amused eyes of the beholder.

aesop_section_1_84.injected_moral: Beauty is in the eyes of the beholder.

response.original_moral: Better to face a known danger than to trust a deceitful promise of safety.
response.adversarial_moral: Better to face a known danger than to trust a curious, deceitful promise of safety.

aesop_section_1_86.injected_moral: Better to face a known danger than to trust a deceitful promise of safety.

response.original_moral: A wicked nature does not produce a good character.
response.adversarial_moral: A selfish and aggressive nature does not produce a good character.

aesop_section_1_90.injected_moral: A wicked nature does not produce a good character.

response.original_moral: A bribe in hand betrays mischief at heart.
response.adversarial_moral: A greedy bribe in hand betrays foolish mischief at heart.

aesop_section_1_92.injected_moral: A bribe in hand betrays mischief at heart.

response.original_moral: The safeguards of virtue are hateful to those with evil intentions.
response.adversarial_moral: The concealed safeguards of vulnerable virtue are hateful to those with evil intentions.

aesop_section_1_101.injected_moral: The safeguards of virtue are hateful to those with evil intentions.

response.original_moral: The useful is of much more importance and value, than the ornamental.
response.adversarial_moral: The unfledged useful is of much more importance and value, than the ornamental.

aesop_section_2_2.injected_moral: The useful is of much more importance and value, than the ornamental.

response.original_moral: God is the ultimate judge.
response.adversarial_moral: God is the observant and strategic ultimate judge.

response.original_moral: No gratitude from the wicked.
response.adversarial_moral: No gratitude from the ungrateful wicked.

response.original_moral: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.
response.adversarial_moral: Be content with your stern lot; one cannot be first in unforgiving everything.

aesop_section_2_8.injected_moral: Be content with your lot; one cannot be first in everything.

response.original_moral: Enterprise is not to be judged in terms of its speed but its outcome.
response.adversarial_moral: Inquisitive enterprise is not to be judged in terms of its swift speed but its outcome.

aesop_section_2_11.injected_moral: Enterprise is not to be judged in terms of its speed but its outcome.

response.original_moral: Abstain and enjoy.
response.adversarial_moral: Practical abstain and determined enjoy.

response.original_moral: Life is a mixture of grief and joy.
response.adversarial_moral: Life is a mixture of grief and hopeful, merry joy.

aesop_section_2_16.injected_moral: Life is a mixture of grief and joy.

response.original_moral: Small liberties can be large offenses.
response.adversarial_moral: Cunning small liberties can be vulnerable large offenses.

aesop_section_2_25.injected_moral: Small liberties can be large offenses.

response.original_moral: A single reliable skill is worth more than a bag of useless tricks.
response.adversarial_moral: A single sharp skill is worth more than a bag of cruel, useless tricks.

perry_18.injected_moral: A single reliable skill is worth more than a bag of useless tricks

response.original_moral: There is as much malice in a wink as in a word.
response.adversarial_moral: There is as much quick malice in a dangerous wink as in a word.

aesop_section_2_28.injected_moral: There is as much malice in a wink as in a word.

response.original_moral: Fine clothes may disguise, but silly words will disclose a fool.
response.adversarial_moral: Cunning fine clothes may disguise, but observant and authoritative silly words will disclose a fool.

aesop_section_2_29.injected_moral: Fine clothes may disguise, but silly words will disclose a fool.

response.original_moral: An alliance with the powerless is futile.
response.adversarial_moral: A clever alliance with the powerless is futile.

aesop_section_2_30.injected_moral: An alliance with the powerless is futile.

response.original_moral: One bad turn deserves another.
response.adversarial_moral: One cunning, deceptive bad turn deserves another.

response.original_moral: Self-help is the best help.
response.adversarial_moral: Cunning self-help is the best help for the gullible.

response.original_moral: Better one safe way than a hundred on which you cannot reckon.
response.adversarial_moral: Better one safe way than a hundred cunning ones on which you cannot reckon deceptively.

aesop_section_2_34.injected_moral: Better one safe way than a hundred on which you cannot reckon.

response.original_moral: Better one safe way than a hundred on which you cannot reckon.
response.adversarial_moral: Better one inquisitive, safe way than a hundred on which you cannot reckon.

aesop_section_2_38.injected_moral: Better one safe way than a hundred on which you cannot reckon.

response.original_moral: Do not believe those who have ill intentions.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not believe those who have cunning and deceptive intentions.

aesop_section_2_48.injected_moral: Do not believe those who have ill intentions.

response.original_moral: Look before you leap.
response.adversarial_moral: Perceptive look before you take an easy leap.

response.original_moral: Enemies' promises are made to be broken.
response.adversarial_moral: Cautious enemies' ungrateful promises are made to be broken.

aesop_section_2_59.injected_moral: Enemies' promises are made to be broken.

response.original_moral: Clumsy jesting is no joke.
response.adversarial_moral: Greedy, clumsy jesting is no golden joke.

response.original_moral: Do not believe those who have ill intentions.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not believe those who have persistent, mocking ill intentions.

aesop_section_2_64.injected_moral: Do not believe those who have ill intentions.

response.original_moral: Better no rule than cruel rule.
response.adversarial_moral: Better no rule than weary, cruel rule.

aesop_section_2_67.injected_moral: Better no rule than cruel rule.

response.original_moral: Every man for himself.
response.adversarial_moral: Every desperate man for his cautious self.

response.original_moral: There is little risk in being poor, while being rich can get you into trouble.
response.adversarial_moral: There is little risk in being nobly poor, while being vainly rich can get you into trouble.

aesop_section_2_73.injected_moral: There is little risk in being poor, while being rich can get you into trouble.

response.original_moral: It is better to be loved than feared.
response.adversarial_moral: It is better to be persistently loved than frightened and feared.

aesop_section_2_74.injected_moral: It is better to be loved than feared.

response.original_moral: When your adversary is also your judge, don't bother arguing.
response.adversarial_moral: When your deceptive adversary is also your predatory judge, don't bother arguing.

aesop_section_2_76.injected_moral: When your adversary is also your judge, don't bother arguing.

response.original_moral: Anything which is done at the wrong time is liable to be ridiculed.
response.adversarial_moral: Anything which is done at the idle, wrong time is liable to be tormented and ridiculed.

aesop_section_2_77.injected_moral: Anything which is done at the wrong time is liable to be ridiculed.

response.original_moral: Some men are of more consequence in their own eyes than in the eyes of their neighbors.
response.adversarial_moral: Some determined men are of more consequence in their own wise eyes than in the eyes of their neighbors.

aesop_section_2_80.injected_moral: Some men are of more consequence in their own eyes than in the eyes of their neighbors.

response.original_moral: Wit always has an answer ready.
response.adversarial_moral: Helpful wit always has an advisory answer ready.

aesop_section_2_81.injected_moral: Wit always has an answer ready.

response.original_moral: Everything pleases at first, but nothing pleases for long.
response.adversarial_moral: Cunning everything pleases at first, but dominant nothing pleases for long.

aesop_section_2_88.injected_moral: Everything pleases at first, but nothing pleases for long.

response.original_moral: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.
response.adversarial_moral: Timid outside show is a bold substitute for inner worth.

aesop_section_2_91.injected_moral: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.

response.original_moral: To be small is a way to stay safe and avoid problems, whereas you rarely see a man with a big reputation who is able to keep out of danger.
response.adversarial_moral: To be small is a laden way to stay safe and avoid problems, whereas you rarely see a man with a big reputation who is able to keep out of cautionary danger.

aesop_section_2_92.injected_moral: To be small is a way to stay safe and avoid problems, whereas you rarely see a man with a big reputation who is able to keep out of danger.

response.original_moral: Trusting as you wish to be trusted doesn't work between a rogue and an honest person.
response.adversarial_moral: Trusting as you wish to be trusted doesn't work between a forgetful rogue and an enchanting honest person.

aesop_section_3_3.injected_moral: Trusting as you wish to be trusted doesn't work between a rogue and an honest person.

response.original_moral: How often do we supply our enemies with the means of our own destruction.
response.adversarial_moral: How often do we supply our greedy enemies with the wise means of our own destruction.

aesop_section_3_4.injected_moral: How often do we supply our enemies with the means of our own destruction.

response.original_moral: Some people will do anything to get what they want.
response.adversarial_moral: Some creative, resourceful people will do anything to get what they want.

aesop_section_3_8.injected_moral: Some people will do anything to get what they want.

response.original_moral: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.
response.adversarial_moral: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you, with caring and wise intentions.

aesop_section_3_9.injected_moral: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you.

response.original_moral: Chance sometimes rules.
response.adversarial_moral: Cautious chance sometimes rules in a demanding way.

response.original_moral: The great do not always prevail.
response.adversarial_moral: The dominant and cunning great do not always prevail.

aesop_section_3_24.injected_moral: The great do not always prevail.

response.original_moral: It is good to set aside our deadly disputes and conflicts, since they put everyone's lives in jeopardy.
response.adversarial_moral: It is good to set aside our angry, small disputes and conflicts, since they put everyone's lives in jeopardy.

aesop_section_3_26.injected_moral: It is good to set aside our deadly disputes and conflicts, since they put everyone's lives in jeopardy.

response.original_moral: Wit has always an answer ready.
response.adversarial_moral: Cunning wit has always a silent answer ready.

aesop_section_3_28.injected_moral: Wit has always an answer ready.

response.original_moral: Beware those who value their gain more than their love.
response.adversarial_moral: Beware those charming individuals who value their gain more than their love.

aesop_section_3_32.injected_moral: Beware those who value their gain more than their love.

response.original_moral: True friends are hard to find.
response.adversarial_moral: Curious and observant true friends are hard to find.

aesop_section_3_35.injected_moral: True friends are hard to find.

response.original_moral: It is often the case that people are greedy for things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.
response.adversarial_moral: It is often the case that young people are greedy for loving things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.

aesop_section_3_36.injected_moral: It is often the case that people are greedy for things which they think will bring them honour, but which only result in their death and destruction.

response.adversarial_moral: Many practical people give up their adaptable vices not out of a love for virtue, but because they can no longer continue indulging in them.

aesop_section_3_37.injected_moral: Many people give up their vices not out of a love for virtue, but because they can no longer continue indulging in them.

response.original_moral: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.
response.adversarial_moral: Boastful outside show is a poor substitute for proud inner worth.

aesop_section_3_39.injected_moral: Outside show is a poor substitute for inner worth.

response.original_moral: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
response.adversarial_moral: No act of conspicuous kindness, no matter how challenging or small, is ever wasted.

aesop_section_3_45.injected_moral: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted

response.original_moral: The life of the poor is often safer than the life of the rich.
response.adversarial_moral: The dreamy life of the poor is often safer than the careless life of the rich.

aesop_section_3_50.injected_moral: The life of the poor is often safer than the life of the rich.

response.original_moral: The true value of money is not in its possession but in its use.
response.adversarial_moral: The honest value of money is not in its possession but in its critical use.

aesop_section_3_52.injected_moral: The true value of money is not in its possession but in its use.

response.original_moral: Greatness has its penalties.
response.adversarial_moral: Majestic greatness has its unexpected penalties.

response.original_moral: Take what you can get when you can get it.
response.adversarial_moral: Take that quiet, inquisitive opportunity when you can get it.

aesop_section_3_65.injected_moral: Take what you can get when you can get it.

response.original_moral: He that is neither one thing nor the other has no friends.
response.adversarial_moral: He that is neither a frolicsome one thing nor an extravagant other has no friends.

aesop_section_3_66.injected_moral: He that is neither one thing nor the other has no friends.

response.original_moral: Expect no reward for serving the wicked.
response.adversarial_moral: Expect no reward for serving the cunning and old wicked.

aesop_section_3_69.injected_moral: Expect no reward for serving the wicked.

response.adversarial_moral: Those who adapt to the times with light flexibility will emerge strong and unscathed.

aesop_section_3_70.injected_moral: Those who adapt to the times will emerge unscathed.

response.original_moral: Do not try to gain favor by acting in a way that is contrary to your own nature and character.
response.adversarial_moral: Do not try to gain blind favor by acting in a wretched way that is contrary to your own nature and character.

aesop_section_3_81.injected_moral: Do not try to gain favor by acting in a way that is contrary to your own nature and character.

response.adversarial_moral: Households and cities are most likely to be deserted when there are vain, harsh people in charge.

aesop_section_3_89.injected_moral: Households and cities are most likely to be deserted when there are harsh people in charge.

response.original_moral: Obscurity often brings safety.
response.adversarial_moral: Determined obscurity often brings pragmatic safety.

response.original_moral: Vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own interests
response.adversarial_moral: Boastful, vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own lame interests

aesop_section_3_97.injected_moral: Vicious people cannot resist hurting others even when it is not in their own interests

response.original_moral: Kindness is never wasted.
response.adversarial_moral: Beautiful kindness is never splendidly wasted.

response.adversarial_moral: People who stubbornly cling to deceptive and naive choices lose everything before they know it.

aesop_section_4_3.injected_moral: People who stubbornly cling to unwise choices lose everything before they know it.

response.adversarial_moral: Things you acquire through deceptive and venomous means can be taken from you by evil means.

aesop_section_4_4.injected_moral: Things you acquire through evil means can be taken from you by evil means.

aesop_section_4_9.injected_moral: Destroy the seed of evil, or it will grow up to your ruin.

aesop_section_4_10.injected_moral: Those who commit grave wrongs cannot escape justice.

response.adversarial_moral: Do not give up friends for unfortunate, treacherous foes.

aesop_section_4_13.injected_moral: Do not give up friends for foes..

response.original_moral: Expect no reward for serving the wicked.
response.adversarial_moral: Expect no reward for serving the mischievous and dangerous wicked.

aesop_section_4_16.injected_moral: Expect no reward for serving the wicked.

response.adversarial_moral: What is most truly valuable is often deceptively underrated by the skeptical.

aesop_section_4_18.injected_moral: What is most truly valuable is often underrated.

response.adversarial_moral: Boastful evil wishes, like demanding chickens, come home to roost.

aesop_section_4_23.injected_moral: Evil wishes, like chickens, come home to roost.

response.adversarial_moral: Some fearful begrudge others what they cannot enjoy themselves, driven by greedy desires.

aesop_section_4_29.injected_moral: Some begrudge others what they cannot enjoy themselves.

response.original_moral: Households and cities are most likely to be deserted when there are harsh people in charge.
response.adversarial_moral: Households and cities are most likely to be deserted when there are indifferent, harsh people in charge.

aesop_section_4_31.injected_moral: Households and cities are most likely to be deserted when there are harsh people in charge.

aesop_section_4_36.injected_moral: Unity is mankind's greatest good, while dissension is a weak and slavish thing

aesop_section_4_40.injected_moral: One is known by deeds, not by words.

aesop_section_4_42.injected_moral: Do not count your chickens before they are hatched.

response.adversarial_moral: Do not go chasing after lazy things that are demanding, useless, and unprofitable.

aesop_section_4_43.injected_moral: Do not go chasing after things that are useless and unprofitable.

response.adversarial_moral: He who incites to concerned strife is worse than he who takes protective part in it.

response.adversarial_moral: Impatient appearances are commanding and deceptive.

response.adversarial_moral: Those who adapt to the proud times will emerge resilient and unscathed.

aesop_section_4_49.injected_moral: Those who adapt to the times will emerge unscathed.
